alfredsnippet.snippet:
De Santillana & Von Dechend, Hamlet's Mill, p.72

"We instinctively dismiss the idea that five or ten thousand years ago there may very well have been thinkers of the order of Kepler, Gauss or Einstein, working with the means at hand."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Our Modern Arrogance About Ancient Thinkers
